content.title: Intro
content.content:
2003
Preceded by
2003
2004
Year
2005
Followed by
2005
You may also be looking for Third Age 2004.

Tolkien-related events that took place in 2004.

content.title: January
content.content:
2 - The Art of The Return of the King is published.
2 - The Lord of the Rings Complete Visual Companion is published.
5 - Graphic novel Heaven's War is published.
7 - Dutch translator Willy Wielek-Berg dies.

content.title: February
content.content:
5 - Andy Serkis wins an Empire Award in the category Best British Actor, for his role as Gollum in The Lord of the Rings (film series).
22 - At the 10th Screen Actors Guild Awards, The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King wins the award for "Outstanding Performance by a Cast in a Motion Picture".
25 - The Two Towers Anthology is released by Decipher.
29 - The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King wins 11 Oscars at the 76th Academy Awards.

content.title: March
content.content: 16 - The World of Tolkien is published.

content.title: May
content.content:
1 - There and Back Again: In the Footsteps of J.R.R. Tolkien's England is published.
15-16 - Tolkien Weekend 2004 at Sarehole Mill.
24 - Understanding The Lord of the Rings is published.

content.title: June
content.content:
3-5 - Lord of the Rings Symphony in Atlanta, GA, Atlanta Symphony Hall
30 - War and the Works of J.R.R. Tolkien is published.

content.title: July
content.content:
1-2 - Lord of the Rings Symphony in Houston, TX, Jones Hall.
10 - German translator Hans J. Sch√ºtz dies.
13 - Lord of the Rings Symphony in Philadelphia, PA, Mann Center
13-15 - Tolkien Thing VI
15-17 - Lord of the Rings Symphony in Seattle, WA, S.Mark Taper Auditorium/Benaroya Hall
29-31 - Lord of the Rings Symphony in Pittsburgh, PA, Heinz Hall
30 - Mythcon 35 begins.
? - Vinyar Tengwar 46 is published.
? - Translating Tolkien: Text and Film is published.

content.title: August
content.content:
2 - Mythcon 35 ends.
12 - Peter Woodthorpe, who voiced Gollum in both The Lord of the Rings (1978 film) as well as The Lord of the Rings 1981 radio series, dies.

content.title: September
content.content:
15 - A new Swedish translation of The Lord of the Rings, made by Erik Andersson, is published.
17-19 - Oxonmoot 2004.
18-19 - Lord of the Rings Symphony in Hartford, CT, Mortensen Hall.
23 - There and Back Again: An Actor's Tale, in which Sean Astin describes the shooting of The Lord of the Rings (film series) from his perspective, is published.
27 - Parma Eldalamberon 15 is published.
28 - The parody book The Sillymarillion is published.
? - Peter Jackson: From Gore to Mordor is published.
? - When a Fan Hits the Shit: The Rise and Fall of a Phony Charity is published.

content.title: October
content.content:
8-9 - The Lord of the Rings Symphony in Chicago, IL, Auditorium Theatre.
12 - The Lord of the Rings Symphony in Milwaukee, WI.
21 - The 50th Anniversary Edition of The Lord of the Rings is published.

content.title: November
content.content:
2 - The Lord of the Rings: The Third Age is released in North America.
5 - The Lord of the Rings: The Third Age is released in Europe.
6 - Hyarion purchases the domain TolkienGateway.net
8 - David Salo's A Gateway to Sindarin is published.
? - Mithril Armoury files for Chapter 7 bankruptcy.

content.title: December
content.content:
3-4 - The Lord of the Rings Symphony plays in Newark, New Jersey.
14 - The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King (extended edition) is released on DVD.
22 - The Lord of the Rings: The Third Age is released in Japan.
26 - Actor Garard Green dies.

? - 2005 An Elvish Travel Calendar is published.
? - The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: Siege of Gondor is published.
? - The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: The Battle of Pelennor Fields is published.
? - Tolkien's Golem is published.
Years
2001 2002 2003 2004 2005 2006 2007
